result.value:
cff-version: 1.2.0
message: "If you use this software, please cite it as below."
title: BridgeDb Webservice
version: 2.1.7
date-released: 2024-01-03
url: "https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice"
preferred-citation:
  - type: article
    authors:
      - family-names: Van Iersel
        given-names: Martijn P.
      - family-names: Pico
        given-names: Alexander R.
      - family-names: Kelder
        given-names: Thomas
      - family-names: Gao
        given-names: Jianjiong
      - family-names: Isaac
        given-names: Ho
      - family-names: Hanspers
        given-names: Kristina
      - family-names: Conklin
        given-names: Bruce R.
      - family-names: Evelo
        given-names: Chris T.
    title: "The BridgeDb framework: standardized access to gene, protein and metabolite identifier mapping services"
    year: 2010
    journal: BMC Bioinformatics
    volume: 11
    issue: 5
    doi: 10.1186/1471-2105-11-5
    url: https://doi.org/10.1186/1471-2105-11-5

The BridgeDb Webservice provides a REST service to access identifier mapping data. It uses the [BridgeDb Java library](https://github.com/bridgedb/bridgedb) and RESTlet technologies to make the webservice available.

BridgeDb ID mapping databases are found on [this](https://bridgedb.github.io/data/gene_database/) website. 

These derby databases are used to perform identifier mapping for a particular species.

The location of the downloaded files is needed for the below described gdb.config file.

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.10453872.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10453872)

This release updates several dependencies: BridgeDb 3.0.25, org.json 20231013, JUnit 5.10.1, and org.restlet 2.4.3. The testing got hardened.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.1.6...2.1.7
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.7

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.8396377.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8396377)

This release adds serving the Swagger/OpenAPI interactive documentation, removing the need to host a separate web server for this documentation.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.1.5...2.1.6
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.6

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.8278801.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8278801)

Minor update release, based on [BridgeDb 3.0.23](https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDb/releases/tag/release_3.0.23), and updating a few dependencies.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.1.4...2.1.5
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.5

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.8021305.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8021305)

Minor update release, based on [BridgeDb 3.0.22](https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDb/releases/tag/release_3.0.22), and updating a few dependencies.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.1.3...2.1.4
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.4

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.7748931.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7748931)

Major release tweaking the JSON output, fixes the returning of identifiers in the`/xrefBatch/$DataSource` call, fixes a few error messages for bad input, and includes many more tests and some further code clean up. Everyone is encouraged to upgrade to this version.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.1.2...2.1.3
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.3

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.7730436.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7730436)

Minor release adding a command line `-v` option to output the BridgeDb and BridgeDb Webservices versions.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.1.1...2.1.2
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.2

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.7722990.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7722990)

Third release with important fixes. It adds testing, using a dynamically started test instance with a SARS-CoV-2 ID mapping databases. Fixed in this release is the returning of mapped identifiers in plain text, adds the missing support for filtering target data sources with `?datasource=X`, and fixes the batch method to return identifiers in the original format in plain text.

## New Contributors
* @jmillanacosta made their first contribution in https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/pull/7

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.1.0...2.1.1
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.1

result.description:
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.7678825.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7678825)

Second release of the new BridgeDb Webservice. This release is based on BridgeDb 3.0.20, supports JSON output, is backwards compatible with the plain text output, and can be executed from a single jar. I can be executed with:

```shell
java -jar BridgeDbWebservice-2.1.0-jar-with-dependencies.jar
```

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/compare/2.0...2.1.0
result.name: BridgeDb Webservice 2.1.0

result.description: First release of the refactored BridgeDb webservice
result.name: v2.0

result.value: Use the latest jar file available here: [link](https://github.com/bridgedb/BridgeDbWebservice/releases/download/2.1.5/BridgeDbWebservice-2.1.7-jar-with-dependencies.jar)

The gdb.config ("gene database configuration") file in the repository should be customized to point to each local derby file you have downloaded. 

For example, if you are only interested in mapping identifiers for Homo sapiens, your gdb.config file would look like:

```bash
Homo sapiens C:/.../Path_To_Derby_Database/Hs_Derby_Ensembl_XXX.bridge
```

where "Homo sapiens" and the path to the derby database are separated by a tab.

Point your browser to: http://localhost:8080/Human/attributeSet

Please see [Swagger Documentation](https://bridgedb.github.io/swagger/#/Identifiers%20(Genes%2C%20proteins%2C%20metabolites%2C%20interactions)/get__organism__properties) for your reference to see which endpoints are available for you to use.

Update the version numbers in these three files:

- `pom.xml`
- `CITATION.cff`
- `src/main/resources/webservice.props`

When starting the webservice, the gdb.config file will be parsed to determine which gene databases you have configured.

Navigating to the folder where you saved the jar file and run the following line:

```bash
java -jar target/BridgeDbWebservice-*-jar-with-dependencies.jar
```

The jar file takes three optional parameters, the port, a boolean if CORS should be enabled, and the server URL.
For example, the following the are valid instructions to start a server:

```bash
java -jar target/BridgeDbWebservice-*-jar-with-dependencies.jar 8888
java -jar target/BridgeDbWebservice-*-jar-with-dependencies.jar 8888 false https://example.org/
```
